internal.content:
---
title: UI Interaction with Dialogs
---
As part of the 7.6.1.0 release, the Automation Script framework was enhanced to support interacting with the classic Maximo UI. This was useful when the dialog called an automation script action because you could now close the dialog after invoking your logic. In previous releases you had to train your user to click another button to cause the dialog to close because the button can only invoke one action. It couldn't call the script and dialogok for example.

Utilizing the service variable, you can close a dialog from an Action launch point Automation Script by calling:
```python
service.closeDialog()
```

This was enhanced in 7.6.1.1 to support launching a dialog as well from an Action launch point Automation Script by calling:
```python
service.launchDialog("dialogid")
```

MdxNode.rawBody:
---
title: UI Interaction with Dialogs
---
As part of the 7.6.1.0 release, the Automation Script framework was enhanced to support interacting with the classic Maximo UI. This was useful when the dialog called an automation script action because you could now close the dialog after invoking your logic. In previous releases you had to train your user to click another button to cause the dialog to close because the button can only invoke one action. It couldn't call the script and dialogok for example.

Utilizing the service variable, you can close a dialog from an Action launch point Automation Script by calling:
```python
service.closeDialog()
```

This was enhanced in 7.6.1.1 to support launching a dialog as well from an Action launch point Automation Script by calling:
```python
service.launchDialog("dialogid")
```
